basics.name: Milad Mohammadi
basics.label: AI Software Engineer & Researcher
basics.summary: My work sits at the intersection of language agents and psychology: (1) building clinically responsible mental-health assistants and multi-agent systems with a focus on modeling human psychological traits, and (2) applying psychological and cognitive theory to analyze and improve agent behavior, safety, and human–AI interaction.

work.name: Adan AI
work.summary: Agentic customer-service systems, RAG & tooling, and production observability.
highlights: Architected a ReAct/Reflexion workflow with >15 tool steps for a national bank chatbot; defined production evaluation metrics.
Built a Persian PDF→chunking pipeline (table/chart-aware parsing, entity extraction), cutting processing cost ~50% and improving RAG accuracy ~8%.
Shipped an automatic FAQ-bot generator; onboarding time reduced from days to <1 hour.
Engineered reusable agent-infrastructure modules (session tokens, conversation summarization, entity/metadata enrichment) adopted across LangGraph projects.
Proposed and deployed LangFuse for observability (tracing, latency/error monitoring, evaluation dashboards).

work.name: NLP Lab, University of Tehran
work.summary: Language-agent research and lab collaboration under Prof. Hesham Faili.
highlights: Contributed to weekly research meetings (discussion, paper critique, project planning) and collaborative development.
Led projects on agent architecture, tool integration, and planning; mentored incoming M.Sc. students on agentic-LLM topics.

work.name: Computational Cognitive Psychology Lab, University of Tehran
work.summary: LLMs for psychological applications with Prof. Hadi Moradi.
highlights: Initiated a lab track on agentic modeling of mental states, complementing prior EEG and classical ML lines.

work.name: Tizfekri
work.summary: Product discovery and requirements for an LMS on thinking skills.
highlights: Translated pedagogy into user stories, specs, and an MVP roadmap.

teaching.name: ECE, University of Tehran
teaching.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant — Large Language Models
teaching.summary: Course project design and workshop delivery.
highlights: Designed multi-stage assignment on language agents (prompt router → ReAct Text-to-SQL on BIRD); authored rubric; graded midterm/final.
Led a hands-on LangGraph workshop. GitHub/YouTube linked in course materials.

teaching.name: University of Tehran
teaching.position: Workshop Instructor — Artificial Intelligence & Digital Transformation
teaching.summary: Two large-venue lectures (500+ students) on prompting, language-agent concepts, and n8n workflow agents for non-engineering cohorts.

teaching.name: ECE, University of Tehran
teaching.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant — Natural Language Processing
highlights: Authored final project 'ChatFood' (agentic food-ordering bot with RAG + tools + Reflexion).
Ran a 4-hour workshop on LangGraph, LanceDB, and Chainlit.

teaching.name: ECE, University of Tehran
teaching.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant — Intelligent Information Retrieval
teaching.summary: Assignments and workshops on sparse/dense retrieval and RAG.
highlights: Designed NanoSparseRetriever (from-scratch TF-IDF/BM25 assignment); taught OpenAI + RAG pipelines with LanceDB.

teaching.name: ECE, University of Tehran
teaching.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant — Deep Learning & Neural Networks
highlights: Designed Gemma-2 Persian chat fine-tuning project (Prefix-Tuning, LoRA, QLoRA); delivered HF Transformers workshop.

teaching.name: INSA Lyon × University of Isfahan
teaching.summary: Workshops and 1:1 technical support; cross-institution coordination.

courses: Thesis: Design and Implementation of an Intelligent Assistant for Clinical Assessment and Diagnosis of Mental Disorders Using Large Language Models
Final Project: Structured feedback collection and evaluation system for TAs and RAs to enhance instructional and research support quality

awards.title: Ranked 1st nationwide in IT Engineering — Graduate Entrance Exam (Konkur)
awards.summary: Top national rank in IT Engineering for the 2023 graduate entrance examination.

publications.name: SchemaGraphSQL: Efficient Schema Linking with Pathfinding Graph Algorithms for Text-to-SQL on Large-Scale Databases
publications.summary: Safdarian, A., Mohammadi, M., Jahanbakhsh, E., Naderi, M. S., & Faili, H.

publications.name: PerMedCQA: Benchmarking Large Language Models on Medical Consumer Question Answering in Persian Language
publications.summary: Jamali, N., Mohammadi, M., Baledi, D., Rezvani, Z., & Faili, H.

publications.name: UT-NLP at SemEval-2025 Task 11: Evaluating Zero-Shot Capability of GPT-4o mini on Emotion Recognition via Role-Play and Contrastive Judging
publications.summary: Mohammadi, M.*, Safdarian, A.*, & Faili, H. (*Equal contribution)

projects.name: Text-to-Insight Data Analyst Agent (Text2SQL & Data Visualization)
projects.summary: NL→SQL over curated SQLite (BIRD), auto-generated Python analysis (tables/plots) and written report; LLM-as-judge for component and end-to-end evaluation.

projects.name: MedYar — Health Reservation Agent (Triage & Booking)
projects.summary: Symptom intake → specialty routing → preference capture → availability check → booking on Paziresh24 via web automation; ReAct-style tool-use agent.

volunteer.summary: 10-week nationwide course led by Dr. Ali Sharifi-Zarchi, supporting 4,500+ high-school students.
highlights: Coordinated mentoring and content across a 110-member team.

volunteer.organization: ACM Student Chapter, University of Isfahan
volunteer.summary: Organized contests and taught algorithm design; weekly ICPC trainings.
Founded and led the TEDx series (planning, sponsorship, marketing, speaker coaching).
